section.title: Root Shell must be on / filesystem
section.para:
Changes the root accountâ€™s shell to the default /bin/bash if the current shell does not reside on the / filesystem. On Solaris systems, this module will set the shell to /sbin/sh if the module fails.
/bin/bash
Files and Directories /bin/bash
/sbin/sh
Files and Directories /sbin/sh

It is recommended that you apply this module. This module ensures that root has a shell which resides on the / filesystem. It is important for root to have a shell if it has problems mounting other filesystems.

listitem.para: CC-3 - Secure Configurations for Hardware and Software on Laptops, Workstations, and Servers
GEN001080 - The root shell must be located in the / file system.
